Package algorithms.graphs

Class SetCover

java.lang.Object
algorithms.graphs.SetCover
public class SetCover extends Object
Given a set of elements {1,2,...,n} (called the universe) and a collection S of m sets whose union equals the universe, the set cover problem is to identify the smallest sub-collection of S whose union equals the universe. For example, consider the universe U={1,2,3,4,5} and the collection of sets S={1,2,3},{2,4},{3,4},{4,5}. Clearly the union of S is U. However, we can cover all of the elements with the following, smaller number of sets: {1,2,3},{4,5}. Set Cover is one of Karp's 21 NP-complete problems shown to be NP-complete in 1972. A set cover is the smallest vertex cover of a graph, where a vertex cover is a subset of a graph's vertices which represents at least one vertex from every edge in the full graph 
 https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Set_cover_problem
Author:
nichole

  • Method Details

    • weightedElementsApprox2LgN

      public gnu.trove.set.TIntSet weightedElementsApprox2LgN(int nU, List<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> sets, double[] weights)
      find a minimum weighted set cover using a randomized rounding approximation algorithm of 2*log_e(n) where n is the number of vertexes in the final cover (== nU). TODO: revisit this for element weights. The cost of the sets in the cover is minimized. The problem is NP-complete.
      Parameters:
      nU - the number of items in U. U is the universe of elements in sets. items in U are the sequential range of integers from 0 to nU-1.
      sets - a list of sets for which each set contains integers from the range 0 through weights.length - 1, inclusive.
      weights - the weights of each element.
      Returns:
      the list of indexes of sets which comprise the cover, that is the indexes of the minimum subset of sets that together include all numbers 0 through nU-1, inclusive.

    • weightedSetsApprox2LgN

      public gnu.trove.set.TIntSet weightedSetsApprox2LgN(int nU, List<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> sets, double[] weights)
      find a minimum weighted set cover using a randomized rounding approximation algorithm of 2*log_e(n) where n is the number of vertexes in the final cover (== nU). The cost of the sets in the cover is minimized. The problem is NP-complete.
      Parameters:
      nU - the number of items in U. U is the universe of elements in sets. items in U are the sequential range of integers from 0 to nU-1.
      sets - a list of sets for which each set contains integers from the range 0 through weights.length - 1, inclusive.
      weights - the weights of each set in sets.
      Returns:
      the list of indexes of sets which comprise the cover, that is the indexes of the minimum subset of sets that together include all numbers 0 through nU-1, inclusive.

    • approxLgN

      public gnu.trove.list.TIntList approxLgN(List<gnu.trove.set.TIntSet> sets)
      find a set cover that is O(log-n)-approx, that is no more than O(log-n) times as large as the optimal set cover (e.g., for n=100, this would be up to 6.64 times as large as the optimal solution). This is a greedy approach. The runtime complexity is polynomial. 
       The algorithm implements pseudocode from
  from https://www.ics.uci.edu/~goodrich/teach/graph/notes/Approximation.pdf
 and Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein "Introduction to Algorithms" chap 35.3.
      Parameters:
      sets -
      Returns:
      the list of indexes of sets which comprise the cover.
